txt.en:
'The fate that befell me and my men is more frightful than any the living can imagine. The decision I made that day long past will haunt me for however long I remain in this realm.

'I can no longer control my men...that much is clear to me. Our once strong force is broken, most of them driven mad by the passing of the years, while others still foolishly revel in the riches that cursed us.

'To the south, brutish men have gathered and seek to pilfer the relics of this land. It disgusts me that they have remained mostly beneath the notice of your allies. Return to whoever sent you here and alert them of their foolishness.'

Idmar listens as you tell the tale of Doron and his cursed forces.

'So, he is aware of the brigands to the south? Interesting. We know of them, but our attempts to root them out have been fruitless as of yet. Perhaps it is time for us to take action against them.

'Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I am sure that this is not the last of our dealings with Doron and his men.'
Doron and his men have discovered brigands to the south that have pillaged the nearby ruins at Ost Celebrant.
Idmar is at his camp along the road in central Parth Celebrant.\n\nDoron bade you return to Idmar.
